differential_diagnosis: acutely decompensated maple syrup urine disease
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by imaging findings of bilateral Achilles tendon xanthoma and characteristic neuroimaging features, including cerebral and cerebellar atrophy along with periventricular white matter lesions. The combination of these findings, along with the patient's clinical history of juvenile cataracts and neurologic symptoms, led to the diagnosis of cerebrotendinous xanthomatosis.
